channel.title: Webclient help needed
channel.description:
Okay, today I was trying to make a webclient for my server because I hate using pre-made ones as they're not fully customisable. When I tried I got this error [img]http://www.imgjoe.com/x/oiukjhk.jpg[/img] [code]ClassNotFoundException client.class[/code]
^For those who can't see the picture.
Any ideas on how to solve this?

item.title: Webclient help needed
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Wrong Section BTW :eek: sorry that this is so long but I hope it helps

I had the same problem!! what I did was took the cache folder put it onto my desktop, made a new folder called cache copy and pasted the files the cache folder just made then made it a .zip file uploaded it to dropbox.com got the link went into cachedownloader.java and changed the version to 0 and the one that says change this one to…

private final int VERSION = 0; // Version of cache //private String cacheLink = "http://hybridpvp.net/cache.zip"; // Link to cache private String cacheLink = "CHANGE THIS ONE TO YOUR LINK "; // Link to cache

Also, I went into signlink.java and searched for C:/

This is what it was before (EXAMPLE)

public static String findcachedir() { String as[] = {"C:/hybridpvpnetcache"};

I changed to this

public static String findcachedir() { String as[] = {"C:/"};

underneath it had something like this

I changed to my server/client name

Also this one

Before

public static String sencondDir() { File file = new File("./");

Changed

public static String sencondDir() { File file = new File("C:/");

After that I re-jarred the client but before I signed it I ran it to make sure that it ran properly and then uploaded the client/webclient.jar file to dropbox got the link and used it in this hmtl code

[code]

CLIENT NAME [/code]

Read full topic
